title: Bug 124610: Add a filter on a boolean computed column will cause error.
OB: When a filter is added on a boolean computed column in BIRT, it causes an error.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 
1. Create a BIRT sample data source and a dataset from the table 'orders'.
2. Create a computed column named 'yes/no' with the type 'any' (not boolean) and set its value to 'true' if (row[1] % 2 == 0) or 'false' otherwise.
3. Drag the dataset from the Data Explorer to the Layout.
4. Select the table and click on the 'Filters' tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the 'Add' button.
6. Choose 'yes/no' as the Expression and 'Is True' as the Operator.
7. [Additional information is missing to complete the steps to reproduce the issue. Please provide more details.]
